metadata.title: CVE-2014-3625 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in Pivotal Spring Framework 3.0.4 through 3.2.x before 3.2.12, 4.0.x before 4.0.8, and 4.1.x before 4.1.2 allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via unspecified vectors, related to static resource handling. It was discovered that Spring Framework incorrectly handled inputs. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to read arbitrary files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-3625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-beans-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-context-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-context-support-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-core-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-expression-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-instrument-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-jms-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-messaging-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-orm-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-oxm-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-test-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-transaction-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.2.12-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.2.12-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.12-1').
